revised_title: Influence of Electric Currents on Mollusk Hearts
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the hearts of mollusks, specifically the common snail, to study their behavior under the influence of electric currents. They discovered that an interrupted current could cause an arrest of the rhythmic beat, similar to the inhibition seen in vertebrate hearts. The authors found no evidence of a localized inhibitory or automatic mechanism in the mollusk heart and concluded that it has no distinct nervous connection with the rest of the body.
